title: Twitter and the Changing Research Conversation

last_post.content:
The “bubble” around academic Twitter means that the work of an academic can make a larger impact, but also draw much more potentially negative attention. It also increases the likelihood of academic output being misinterpreted or misunderstood, especially in cases where people are sharing preprints without an understanding of the differences in peer review between these and published works. #Academia #Research

#Globalwarming increases sea surface temperature, which packs more energy into storms that develop over the oceans, making them more damaging.

As oceans have warmed, Africa has experienced four times as many storms as it did in the 1970s.

More frequent and intense rainfall and storms lead to more inland and coastal flooding. Rain-related natural disasters in Africa have grown nearly tenfold over the last 50 years.

title: Why you should share your prepping and recruit others

last_post.content: Preparedness isn’t about Zombies or tin-hatted preppers. It’s about being able to take care of your household if an unexpected but event happens. You are more prepared than you think. I’ve been learning about and teaching urban escape, preparedness, and emergency response for over a decade now. I’ve volunteered with the Red Cross helping people that have lost everything in house fires, and helping people after natural disasters. If you ever want to chat, I’d love that! https://theprepared.com/prepping-basics/guides/why-you-should-share-and-recruit-prepping/

title: What's Hidden in a Randomly Weighted Neural Network?

last_post.content: This finding is a few years old but I didn't know about it and it's blowing my mind. "within a sufficiently overparameterized neural network with random weights (e.g. at initialization), there exists a subnetwork that achieves competitive accuracy." So you can fit a neural net without ever updating the parameters, by weighting, ranking, and pruning edges between the nodes instead! https://arxiv.org/abs/1911.13299
